meanings.definition: To bring back to life or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: The scientist reanimated the dead frog with a jolt of electricity.
meanings.sent2: The old battery was reanimated with a fresh charge.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat was reanimated by the sound of a can opener.
meanings.sent4: The town was reanimated with the arrival of a new circus.
meanings.sent5: The garden was reanimated by the first drops of rain after a long drought.

meanings.sent1: The reanimated patient opened their eyes after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The reanimated flower bloomed beautifully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The reanimated toy seemed to have a new sparkle in its eyes.
meanings.sent4: The reanimated city streets buzzed with energy and life.
meanings.sent5: The reanimated forest was a vibrant tapestry of colors in the autumn.
